column8: Ruthless (and sneaky)|dated=24 April 1971|website=[http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=Fr8DH2VBP9sC&dat=19710424&b_mode=2&hl=en ''The Montreal Gazette'' (Google News Archive)]|accessed=12 February 2012}}</ref> Between [[1956]] to [[1963]] he was Director of Libraries at [[Marquette University]].<ref name=CG/>

column1: Ready foresaw the cultural value of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s writings and
column3: he managed to purchase a large selection of original literary manuscripts by Tolkien in 1956-57
column4: including manuscripts of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.<ref>[[Douglas A. Anderson]]
column5: "The Mainstreaming of Fantasy and the Legacy of ''The Lord of the Rings''"

column2: Ready had arranged a lecture tour for Tolkien at American universities
column3: but Tolkien was forced to decline because of illness. In order to make amends
column4: Tolkien therefore offered Ready to buy his manuscripts.<ref name=Montreal/> However
column5: [[Christina Scull]] and [[Wayne G. Hammond]] have stated (deriving from archived correspondence) that Tolkien "''was directly approached to sell his papers
column6: and did not himself suggest their sale.''"<ref name=CG/>
